intro: Pachystylidium hirsutum var. irritans, commonly known as the rough-stemmed pachystylidium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
